questions.text: What year were soft drinks referred to as pop?
questions.explanation:
1861.

	Regular pop contains 90% water while diet pop contains 99% water.

Dr. Augustine Thompson

	Dr. Augustine Thompson founded Moxie in 1884 while living in Lowell, Massachusetts. Before becoming a soft drink, Moxie was sold to apothecaries as a brain tonic.

questions.text: Charles Alderton invented Dr Pepper. What was his occupation?
questions.explanation:
Pharmacist.

	The year was 1885 when Charles Alderton founded Dr Pepper in Waco, Texas.

questions.text: What city was the beverage Coca-Cola invented in?
questions.explanation:
Atlanta.

	On May 8, 1886, Dr. John Pemberton created Coca-Cola which became his second created beverage. His first beverage was a wine cooler. He died before finishing his third beverage which contained celery extract.

1893.

	In New Bern, North Carolina, Pepsi was invented by Caleb Bradham as a cure for dyspepsia (gastro-intestinal problem also known as an ulcer).

questions.text: Who does the A & W stand for in A & W Root Beer?
questions.explanation:
Allen and Wright.

	In 1919, Roy Allen and Frank Wright sold their first mug of root beer for a nickel. The formula for the root beer was bought by Allen from a pharmacist.

questions.text: Which pop came out two weeks before the Great Depression?
questions.explanation:
7up.

	The soda 7up was originally made with lithium in it. In 1936, 7up Lithinated Lemon Soda was shortened to 7up.

questions.text: Which company put out Mr. Pibb?
questions.explanation:
Coca-Cola.

	The Coca-Cola company put out an imitation of Doctor Pepper called Mr. Pibb eighty-seven years after Doctor Pepper came out.

questions.text: What two pops were put out in the same year?
questions.explanation:
Sprite & Diet Rite.

	In 1961, Sprite and Diet Rite came out.

questions.text: What double caffeinated pop came out in 1997?
questions.explanation:
Surge.

	Surge came out in January of 1997.
